description: {"blocks":[{"key":"eun6e","text":"The E gene was amplified by semi-nested PCR. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
materials_text: {"blocks":[{"key":"9so84","text":"mosquito grinding supernatant,CSF sample that shown positive by detection of JEV by quantitative real-time reverse-transcription(q-RT)-PCR;Tianlong Nucleic Acid Automatic Extractor ,Tianlong Nucleic Acid Extraction Kit ,Ready-To-Go kit ,random primers (pdN6) ,GoTaq Green Master Mix Kit (Promega, Madison, WI, USA) ,The primers used for the first round of E gene PCR were JEV-E-1F (TTCATAGAAGGAGCCAGTGGA) and JEV-E-1R (TCGTTTAAACTCGCGACTGA) ,the primers used for the second round were JEV-E-1F and JEV-E-2R (TTTCCCGAAAAGTCCACATC).The primers used for the first round of C+PrM gene  PCR were JE-C+PrM-1F (CGTTCTTCAAGTTTACAGCATTAGC) and JE-C+PrM-1R (CCYRTGTTYCTGCCAAGCATCCAMCC), and the primers used for the second round were JE-C+PrM-1Fand JE-C+PrM-2R (CGYTTGGAATGYCTRGTCCG).  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it’s working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"61mor","text":"Use Tianlong nucleic acid extraction instrument (automatic nucleic acid extraction instrument, model: np968. C, manufacturer: Suzhou Tianlong Biotechnology Co., Ltd.), and supporting nucleic acid extraction kit: Tianlong nucleic acid extraction kit (magnetic bead method EX-RNA/DNAvirus), manufacturer: Suzhou Tianlong Biotechnology Co., Ltd., for nucleic acid extraction. Perform the following operations in a biosafety cabinet. Add 200 μl of patient cerebrospinal fluid and serum specimens and mosquito grinding supernatant to each well in columns 1 and 7 of the 96-well plate provided with the nucleic acid extraction kit","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"6arkr","text":"33 μl of RNA extract was placed in a 65 ° C water bath for 10 min.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"24uuf","text":"32ul of RNA samples were pipetted into the first chain reaction tube in a Ready-To-Go kit kit (GE Healthcare, Little Chalfont, Buckinghamshire, UK) and allowed to stand at room temperature for 1 min. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cidi2","text":"1 ul of random primer (pdN6) (TaKaRa, Japan) was added to every sample.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"acphi","text":"The E gene sequence of JE virus was amplified by semi-nested PCR. The first round of amplification , using primers: JEV 3F: TTCATAGAAGGAGCCAGTGGA and JEV 3R: TCGTTTAAACTCGCGACTGA.he gene amplification system was 25 ul, including: 2 μl of cDNA template, 12.5 μl of GoTaq ® Green Master Mix-2 × (Promega, Madison, WI), 1 μl of upstream and downstream primers at 10 umol/L, and 8.5 μl of RNase Free Water. The reaction program was: 94 ° C, 8 min for 1 cycle; 94 ° C, 1 min, 55 ° C, 1 min, 72 ° C, 1 min for 35 cycles; 72 ° C, 10 min, keep in 4 ° C.    The second round of amplification sequence was 300 bp, using the first round of PCR product as a template with the forward primer JEV 3F and the reverse primer JEV 2R: TTTCCCGAAAAGTCCACATC.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5omsk","text":" The second round of amplification sequence was 300 bp, using the first round of PCR product as a template with the forward primer JEV 3F and the reverse primer JEV 2R: TTTCCCGAAAAGTCCACATC,the amplification system and reaction program was same as the first round.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"c026b","text":"The C+PrM gene sequence was also amplified by semi-nested PCR according to the same amplification system and  procedure as E gene. The primers used for the first round of PCR were JE-C+PrM-1F (CGTTCTTCAAGTTTACAGCATTAGC) and JE-C+PrM-1R (CCYRTGTTYCTGCCAAGCATCCAMCC)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cm1lv","text":"primers used for the second round were JE-C+PrM-1Fand JE-C+PrM-2R (CGYTTGGAATGYCTRGTCCG). The product of the first round of PCR was used as the template of the second round.The second round also use the same amplification system and  procedure as E gene.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"39pvb","text":"5 µL of the amplification product was detected by 1% agarose gel electrophoresis .","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dvc9q","text":"Nucleotide sequence determination was done by Sangon Biotech Co. Ltd. (Shanghai, China, Beijing Sequencing Department).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"aupbg","text":"The viral gene nucleotide sequences were spliced and corrected using SeqMan II software (DNA Star, Madison, WI, USA). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"c7ta2","text":"The JEV gene sequences used for phylogenetic analysis were downloaded from GenBank( Table S1) .","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fc3q","text":"The ClustalW multiple sequence alignment was performed using BioEdit (Version 7.0, Hall 1999).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"59tn7","text":"Neighbor-joining phylogenetic trees were drawn using MEGA6.0 with 1000 bootstrap replicates.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

title: Phylogenetic analyses of the JEV gene sequence
title_html: Phylogenetic analyses of the JEV gene sequence
